intro: Triumfetta glabrior, commonly known as the smooth triumfetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its hairy, ovate leaves. It typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Triumfetta glabrior is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
